description: I’m deeply engaged in AI alignment and existential risks, concerned that advanced models might drift from their intended goals, so I monitor safety research breakthroughs—methods, benchmarks, and protocols—empirical experiments that reveal misalignment, policy and regulatory updates, and documented failures or accidents across sources like the AI 2027 blog and Guardian reporting to spot early warning signals. I’m also interested in quantum computing’s practical and scientific applications and their broader societal, economic, and ethical impacts.
userInterests: The user seeks to understand how the Russia-Ukraine war is reshaping Europe’s strategic landscape. They are particularly focused on energy security issues—such as gas supply disruptions—alongside the economic fallout of sanctions on EU economies. They also want to track evolving European defense policies and emerging cybersecurity risks tied to the conflict. Their motivation is to stay informed on these broader continental implications for policy, markets, and security.

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Russian attacks on substations are ‘nuclear terrorism’, says Ukraine
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukrainian foreign ministry says deliberate strikes on civilian energy facilities violate international law as fears of a winter crisis grow. What we know on day 1,347

curatedArticles.title: The Nord Stream riddle: echoes of mistrust ripple through Europe
curatedArticles.trailText: Three years after explosion that crippled Russian-German gas link, Polish court’s refusal to extradite Ukrainian suspect reignited old tensions

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Zelenskyy visits troops near embattled Pokrovsk
curatedArticles.trailText: Deep Ukrainian drone strikes hit petrochemical plant 1,300km inside Russia and Lukoil refinery east of Moscow. What we know on day 1,351

curatedArticles.title: Russian forces appear to tighten grip on strategic city of Pokrovsk
curatedArticles.trailText: Military analysts say situation in Pokrovsk has deteriorated, while Kremlin says it plans to explore resumption of nuclear testing

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Trump ‘not really’ considering supplying Tomahawks
curatedArticles.trailText: Turkish refineries cut back on Russian oil in response to sanctions; Ukrainian special forces join defence of embattled Pokrovsk. What we know on day 1,349

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine deploys special forces to Pokrovsk in effort to hold key city
curatedArticles.trailText: Escalating battle for city comes as overnight Russian drone and missile strikes kill six people, including two children

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Ukraine says its troops still holding out in embattled Pokrovsk
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukraine military says it has improved positions in several districts, while Moscow says its troops are enclosing in on Ukrainian forces.

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Putin boasts of nuclear-driven torpedo that would swamp cities with radioactive tsunami
curatedArticles.trailText: Russian president proclaims test of Poseidon which would launch from submarine and carry nuclear engine and warhead. What we know on day 1,345

curatedArticles.title: Ukrainian computer game-style drone attack system goes ‘viral’
curatedArticles.trailText: System rewards soldiers who achieve strikes with points that can be used to buy more weapons in an online store

curatedArticles.title: EU could admit new members by 2030, says its foreign policy chief
curatedArticles.trailText: Kaja Kallas tells reporters more countries could join 27-country bloc, including Montenegro, Albania and Ukraine

description: The user is personally curious about the fields of protein folding and nuclear fusion, driven by their potential to revolutionize healthcare through disease treatment and to provide sustainable energy solutions. This interest is fueled by the transformative impact these advancements could have on the future of humanity.
